definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: Rick alludes that there are other “people” involved in this kidnapping.
sentences.chinese: 里克向她透露，拐骗她们是其他人的授意。

sentences.english: He was shanghaied to Africa before liberation.
sentences.chinese: 解放前他被拐骗到非洲。

sentences.english: You seem to be assisting the government but at the same time you have intensified extortions and abductions.
sentences.chinese: 你们表面上要帮助政府可同时又加紧勒索和拐骗。

sentences.english: Deceiving those that trust us is more than a sin.
sentences.chinese: 拐骗相信本身的人是罪上加罪。

sentences.english: When Tom was a boy, he was shanghaied and sent to North America.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆小时候被拐骗并被送到了北美。

sentences.english: Oppose cheating and dishonesty at all time.

definition: human trafficking/to abduct and sell/to kidnap and sell
to trick sb into having sex
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
